Behaviours
Tooltip visibility
Tooltips can be displayed by any interactive element by hovering
or focusing on it. When hovering, use a 0.3 second delay before
displaying the tooltip. When focusing, display the Tooltip
immediately. Hide Tooltips immediately when hover moves
outside of them or when focus changes from the elements that
trigger them.
ju
Toggletip visibility
Toggletips are displayed/dismissed by an explicit click/tap on
their Toggle.
?
Tooltip group
After triggering the Tooltip of one element, its siblings should
display their Tooltips without the initial delay or any horizontal or
vertical movement. The triggering delay should be activated
again only if the user hovers out of that group for 1 second.

The default position for any tip is centre aligned on the top of the related element, but if
necessary you can position them differently.
Choose between vertical or horizontal positioning based on the orientation of the

covering other elements of the same group.

If you have space, don't use Tooltips
We only recommend using Tooltips for extreme cases. Otherwise, putting information
alongside the related element with labelling or body text is almost always preferred.
Tooltips are a fallback to provide clarity in cases where the Ul is in compact regions.

Use Tooltips for elements
Tooltips should predominantly be used for unlabelled icons to clear up any ambiguities
about their meaning. If you're considering using Tooltips on other elements, think
carefully about why. Any essential and important information should ultimately be
displayed on the page—not within a Tooltip.

Enter and exit
When entering, Tooltips and Toggletips move from their initial to
final position and change their opacity from 0% to 100%. When
exiting, they stay in the same position and only their opacity
changes. The tip's initial position is defined by placing it in its final
position and moving it 12px towards its trigger. Enter
